{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tetracycline is a type of antibiotic that can cause permanent discoloration of teeth when given to children during tooth development. This is known as dental staining. Tooth development is usually completed by the age of 8 years. Therefore, tetracycline should not be given to prevent discoloration after the age of 8 years.", "answer_choice": "B. 8 year"}
